skill.name: kpi-dashboard-design
skill.description: Design effective KPI dashboards with metrics selection, visualization best practices, and real-time monitoring patterns. Use when building business dashboards, selecting metrics, or designing data visualization layouts.
skill.summary: Design effective KPI dashboards with metrics selection, visualization best practices, and real-time ...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, filesystem access, network calls, or environment variable access. SQL and Python examples are embedded code blocks for reference only. Behavior matches stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Design KPI dashboards that drive decisions
content.value_statement: Many dashboards overwhelm teams with unclear metrics and cluttered layouts. This skill guides KPI selection, visualization best practices, and dashboard patterns that focus attention on actionable insights.
actual_capabilities: Explain strategic, tactical, and operational KPI levels with cadence
Provide KPI lists for sales, marketing, product, and finance departments
Show dashboard layout patterns with ASCII wireframes and visual hierarchies
Include SQL examples for MRR, cohort retention, and CAC calculations
Provide a complete Streamlit dashboard code example with charts
List KPI dashboard do and do not practices for effective design
limitations: No live data connections or API calls to external systems
No automated alerting or real-time monitoring configuration
Examples require adaptation to your database schema and tools
No deployment, hosting, or BI tool setup instructions provided

use_cases.title: Define executive KPI view
use_cases.description: Create a one-page summary with headline KPIs, trend indicators, and alert panels for monthly reviews.

use_cases.title: Standardize KPI governance
use_cases.description: Align department KPIs using SMART criteria and establish consistent update frequencies.

use_cases.title: Design real-time monitoring
use_cases.description: Plan an operations center dashboard with system health, throughput metrics, and alert panels.

prompt_templates.title: Starter KPI list
prompt_templates.prompt: List 6 core KPIs for a SaaS executive dashboard and explain why each matters for decision making.

prompt_templates.title: Department splits
prompt_templates.prompt: Create separate KPI sets for sales and marketing with recommended update frequency and intended audience.

prompt_templates.title: Layout critique
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this dashboard outline and propose a clearer hierarchy with better alert placement and focus.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced retention
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a cohort retention analysis section with suggested visualizations and key questions to answer.

output_examples.input: Outline an executive KPI dashboard for a subscription business.
output: Headline KPIs: MRR, ARR, churn rate, NPS score, and active customers
Layout: KPI cards across top row, trend line in second row, product mix chart, alerts strip at bottom
Cadence: Monthly executive review with weekly manager drilldowns and daily operations view

best_practices: Limit dashboards to 5-7 key metrics aligned to specific business goals
Always show trends, targets, and comparisons for context and interpretation
Match update frequency to the decision cadence of each audience level
anti_patterns: Including vanity metrics that look impressive but have no actionability
Overcrowding the dashboard with too many charts and indicators
Hiding metric definitions, calculations, and data sources from viewers

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is entirely prompt-based and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code without any tool requirements.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance, patterns, and code examples only. It does not create live data connections or deploy dashboards.

faq.question: Can I use this with my existing BI tool?
faq.answer: Yes. Apply the KPI frameworks, metric lists, and layout patterns in Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or any custom app.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It is purely static guidance and example code. It never reads, writes, or transmits any user data.

faq.question: What if the suggested KPIs do not fit my business model?
faq.answer: Adapt the framework and SMART criteria to your specific industry, goals, and available data sources.

faq.question: How is this different from a downloadable dashboard template?
faq.answer: It explains the strategy, principles, and patterns behind effective dashboards rather than providing fixed layouts.
